supports a national and global commitment to improving access to, and developing new treatments,
			 diagnostics, and cures for rare diseases and disorders.

Whereas a rare disease or disorder is one that affects a small number of patients – in the United
			 States, typically less than 200,000 individuals annually;

Whereas as of the date of approval of this resolution, nearly 7,000 rare diseases affect
			 approximately 30,000,000 people in the United States and their families;

Whereas children with rare genetic diseases account for more than half of the population affected
			 by rare diseases in the United States;
Whereas many rare diseases are serious, life-threatening, and lack an effective treatment;
